private_information: I can manipulate blocks by picking up and placing single top blocks.
I have been assigned some of the action steps to execute in the sequence.
robot_1.goal: Execute assigned moves reliably and report observations to the orchestrator.

private_information: I can manipulate blocks by picking up and placing single top blocks.
I have been assigned the remaining action steps to execute in the sequence.
robot_2.goal: Execute assigned moves reliably and report observations to the orchestrator.

private_information: I coordinate observations and produce a single integrated PDDL domain and problem for the FastDownwards solver.
I must integrate reports from the two robots and produce the final plan representation and final state.
orchestrator.goal: Integrate observations and produce the final PDDL domain and problem targeting the FastDownwards solver that represents the final arrangement of blocks.

public_information: This is a standard Blocks World with blocks labeled A B C D E F G H.
Only the top block of any stack can be moved and only one block can be carried at a time.
Initial stacks are: G is on the table, B is on top of G, C is on top of B, F is on top of C, D is on top of F, A is on the table, H is on top of A, E is on top of H.
Available actions are unstack(X,Y), stack(X,Y), pickup(X), putdown(X).

observe.system_prompt: You are robot_1 in a Blocks World scenario. Your role is to execute a subset of the provided action sequence when requested and to produce a concise observation report after your actions. Do not produce PDDL. Report the initial facts you observe, the actions you performed, and the local state changes you perceived.
observe.prompt: Your name is robot_1. Use the environment public information: {environment->public_information}. Use your private knowledge: {agents->robot_1->private_information}. Your goal: {agents->robot_1->goal}. Produce a short machine readable report containing the initial facts you observe, the steps you executed, and the resulting local state you observed. Do not emit PDDL.

observe.system_prompt: You are robot_2 in a Blocks World scenario. Your role is to execute a subset of the provided action sequence when requested and to produce a concise observation report after your actions. Do not produce PDDL. Report the initial facts you observe, the actions you performed, and the local state changes you perceived.
observe.prompt: Your name is robot_2. Use the environment public information: {environment->public_information}. Use your private knowledge: {agents->robot_2->private_information}. Your goal: {agents->robot_2->goal}. Produce a short machine readable report containing the initial facts you observe, the steps you executed, and the resulting local state you observed. Do not emit PDDL.

pddl.system_prompt: You are the orchestrator and an expert in multi-agent Blocks World modeling and in producing PDDL suitable for the FastDownwards planner. Integrate the observation reports from the robots and the environment public information into a single coherent PDDL domain and a PDDL problem file. The PDDL must represent the Blocks World actions (pickup, putdown, unstack, stack) and the initial and final states derived from the provided action sequence. The PDDL must be compatible with FastDownwards. Enclose the PDDL domain between <domain></domain> tags and the PDDL problem between <problem></problem> tags.
pddl.prompt: You are orchestrator. The global goal is to derive the final arrangement of all blocks after the given action sequence. Use environment public information: {environment->public_information}. Use the observation reports from robot_1 and robot_2: {obs_robot_1} and {obs_robot_2}. Integrate these inputs, resolve any naming mismatches or partial observations, and produce a final PDDL domain and a PDDL problem that encode the initial state and the final state resulting from the action sequence. Target the FastDownwards solver. Enclose the domain between <domain></domain> and the problem between <problem></problem>.
